body_html: @martinraison OK, that makes me a bit concerned; do we know if cadd is sound when the input tensors are not known to be contiguous? I thought maybe cleverly the "merge" actually is OK when indices go down, but I didn't actually verify this.) If it's not, we better add it back.
body_text: @martinraison OK, that makes me a bit concerned; do we know if cadd is sound when the input tensors are not known to be contiguous? I thought maybe cleverly the "merge" actually is OK when indices go down, but I didn't actually verify this.) If it's not, we better add it back.
body: @martinraison OK, that makes me a bit concerned; do we know if `cadd` is sound when the input tensors are not known to be contiguous? I thought maybe cleverly the "merge" actually is OK when indices go down, but I didn't actually verify this.) If it's not, we better add it back.
